comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Are you downloading a Bitcrack dud that is loaded with malware by any chance?

comments.author: seoincorporation
comments.body: Here are two options... or you get nucked with a hail marry attack, or this was just an intention to spread malware in the forum. The word from your post makes me think you get infected by this virus, but the fact that you posted the link makes me think that you want to spread the virus. So, let's hope you are here for the first option.If your machine got infected you should import your private keys to a new wallet and move the coins before it's too late. Then you can format your server/pc to have a clean install but this time with the right software.

comments.author: Welsh
comments.body: If it was a virus, I'd recommend completely securing the device you had it installed on. What was it, was it a wallet pretending to be Bitcoin Core? You should only download from official sources, and verify it always. Not enough users here verify before installing something. As soon as you execute the program you can probably consider yourself compromised, and since it wouldn't be easy to identify to what extent. It's recommended to take the complete wipe, and isolate approach. What wallet file were you trying to download?

comments.author: Crypt0Gore
comments.body: Your case looks like a hunter who became hunted, are you one of those people that looks for free wallet recovery seed or private keys online? If yes your PC will always be plagued with different types of trojans and malware. Those players are waiting for people like you to download things like this on your PC so they can control your data.
